Well, he usually draws attention and aggression to himself when he's on the battlefield so chances are high that he gets [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt)ed right away! :-/ (believe me, I know...)

Posted By: Schlappi (9/11/2009 3:14:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
let me say that when i first pu this in my deck i thought "wow. amazing. they can't play spells."
  
but the truth is, it's too slow. first of all, the card is useless alone. second, this belongs in a control/mill deck. and tapping yourself out at turn 4 is allowing a 4 or 5 mana card through for your oponent. and playing this any later in the game doesn't work because most players already have what they need in play. last, what if your oponent isn't playing a combo deck? this card is way over rated. it's a fun card for sure, but not enough for me. i'll stick with [haunting echoes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=haunting echoes)
posts.html:
let me say that when i first pu this in my deck i thought "wow. amazing. they can't play spells."
but the truth is, it's too slow. first of all, the card is useless alone. second, this belongs in a control/mill deck. and tapping yourself out at turn 4 is allowing a 4 or 5 mana card through for your oponent. and playing this any later in the game doesn't work because most players already have what they need in play. last, what if your oponent isn't playing a combo deck? this card is way over rated. it's a fun card for sure, but not enough for me. i'll stick with haunting echoes

Posted By: Salostot (8/13/2009 9:59:25 AM)

posts.post_content:
@Lord\_Sauron: When your opponent casts a blue or black spell, it's possible to respond to that, and it's possible to respond to Circu's triggered ability as well. However, once the triggered ability resolves and the cards are actually exiled, you can't cast them.  
  
If you were hoping to cast a spell because one with the same name just got exiled, you're out of luck.
posts.html:
@Lord_Sauron: When your opponent casts a blue or black spell, it's possible to respond to that, and it's possible to respond to Circu's triggered ability as well. However, once the triggered ability resolves and the cards are actually exiled, you can't cast them.

If you were hoping to cast a spell because one with the same name just got exiled, you're out of luck.

posts.post_content: If you want to keep him safe from removal, your best bet is [Memory Lapse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memory Lapse). Think about it for a sec.
